Reviews.Title: Sweet little camera in my pocket
Reviews.Author: DD
Reviews.Content: I ordered this little camera so that I could carry it in my pocket and indeed, the size is perfect for a pocket, purse, on a cord tucked inside your shirt.  The pictures are clear and sharp, the video is also clear and sharp, but the microphone is rather useless as on playback it is nearly impossible to hear what is recorded.  The only problem I find with this camera is that it is SO tiny and the finish SO slick, that it is tricky to handle with one hand and shoot.  I am a horseback rider and have only one hand free to use the camera, and without a grip or a surface that does not easily slip out of your fingers, it is a bit unhandy, which is the reason I give it 4 stars rather than 5.Overall, this is a great camera that you can carry on your person, point and shoot in a blink, and performs very well.  Excellent Amazon service, as always.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the price, it gets the job done...
Reviews.Author: B. G. Pittman III
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for traveling aboard while at work. It's small and lightweight, it will easily fit into your top pocket of your shirt or any other pocket. Most of the pictures that I have taken with it, have turned out great, and most people that have looked at them have committed on what good picture it takes. The only reason I gave it four stars was because sometimes it has a little hard time focusing on certain objects, mostly long distance...like sea and sky pictures. But my 2,000+ dollar Digital SLR sometimes has that same problem. But overall I am very well pleased with this camera. I bought the Amazon 32 gig card to go in it, so that I make sure that I don't run out of picture storage space before I can get to a computer to download the pictures to. The battery will last for a good long time too!

Reviews.Title: My experience
Reviews.Author: JAIRO TABORDA
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellent and very simple operation. It is very practical and very functional size. Its design is very suitable and its size allows for easy and simple. The screen size is also very suitable. Optimizing for Youtube videos is mounting helpful.

Reviews.Title: Casio is just not what it used to be.  They all seem to break in about a year.
Reviews.Author: terster "Terster"
Reviews.Content: I've gone through 3 Casio camera's in the past 18 months.  Every single time it's LENS ERROR.  This is without bumping, without dropping, without banging the camera, etc.First my wife's camera... and then not even 30 days later, mine went out.  My wife's camera was 13 months old where as mine was 5.  Either way... they were both still pretty darn new!I've seen many others if you search... that have the same issues.Casio, per other reviews, is notorious for blaming that the camera was bumped or dropped and nulling the warranty.My most current camera, this one only in Red, broke on me too.  LENS ERROR... and it was being used at the time!Casio, however, did warrant and fix the camera no questions asked so cudo's to them for that.  The camera was only 5 months old.Due to the poor experiences i've had though, i bought a Panasonic DMC SZ7K.  It had almost perfect reviews.Well, the Panasonic showed up before Casio returned my camera fixed and now i can for the first time in many years, compare 2 different camera's.I have truly been a Casio die-hard, until now.The differences in camera's is absolutely night and day.  The Panasonic wins, hands down.  It's cleaner, it is easily 2x faster in turning on and between taking pictures.  It has a burst mode which is really awesome.  The quality of the pictures both during the day and evening, inside and out, is again, incredible.I would not, could not, recommend Casio anymore.  I've burned through 5 of these in only 5 years and as mentioned 3 in the past 18 months.No matter what people buy, i can't stress enough to get a screen protector though.  They are like $5.00 here on Amazon and they work amazingly well.  Your screen will get scratched up over time and these things will protect the camera.  My wife had a Kodak.  IT was dropped by accident on the cement below.  It shattered the corner of the lens protector but the camera remained undamaged in any way.  I pulled off the old protector, got a new one here on amazon and the camera was good to go.Had this been the Casio... 99.99% chance of a LENS ERROR.I just don't understand what's happened to Casio!8 years ago... they would last you 5.  Now, anything less than 2 years... you're lucky to get the full 1 year before they die.  They just are not what they used to be, in our opinion.We now have the Panasonic as mentioned and my wife replaced her Casio with an Olympus and she's super pleased with hers too.  BOTH were under $100... and easily are worth more like $165 in our opinions.Save yourself the coming headache's... keep looking.Due to the the LENS ERROR and now due to how vastly superior both the Olympus and the Panasonic camera's are when compared to this one... i rate this only 2 stars.I do give Casio credit though for not arguing with me with regard to fixing mine and turnover was pretty fast, inside of 2 weeks.  I didn't even have to call them.  Just an online form and mailing it back. Done.But, to learn now by buying 2 other ones... i would not buy Casio again for a long time.For what it's worth.T

Reviews.Title: great item at a great price
Reviews.Author: proud moma
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the quality of this item.  Our son had it and when we saw it at such a good price, we bought one for our daughter/

Reviews.Title: Tiny and great
Reviews.Author: AmyKay
Reviews.Content: Pros: great picture quality for both short and long distances, very small, easy to use, large screen to play back photos/videos, charges the battery through the camera rather than a separate piece of equipment, cheap especially for the quality of photosCons: buttons are very sensitive that can turn the camera on when you don't want it to causing the lens to open (I had to get mine fixed twice for this problem as it jammed the lens), USB protector is a little hard to get out when you want to charge the camera,Overall this camera is awesome. I would suggest buying a hard case, since I've had issues with the camera turning on when I don't want it to which jams the lens. I would recommend this camera to friends.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Tim L.
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the on the go photographer! It provides great pictures with little noise and is much better than a cannon or nikon. It doesn't match the professional quality of a Sony a35 DSLR but it still does a great job! the 720 HD is amazing and the options are easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: good price/quality
Reviews.Author: Ignacio
Reviews.Content: Is a fast camera and has a good relation between the price and quality. The video capture is really good tooI recommend this item!

Reviews.Title: Great little point n shoot
Reviews.Author: adrenalnjunky
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd Exilim in 10 years - the first lasted 8 before finally giving up and losing the ability to focus.  I consider that my money's worth for a camera my wife carried everywhere and took thousands of photos with.The second was bought last year to replace it and did a great job until someone decided to remove it from our car one evening (along with several other items).This one was just bought to record our child's entrance to the world, which could be any time now.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with lots of features, but...
Reviews.Author: Bobella
Reviews.Content: This was the third Exilim I've owned.  And, just like my previous (2) models, they end up dying shortly after the 1 year warranty.  This particular model just reached the 14 month mark when the lens motor quit working correctly and eventually ceasing to work at all.You get some good pics and video for the price, but keep in mind it's not going to last much longer than the warranty.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: BadBoyWill
Reviews.Content: My first camera ever. And i have to say its very good so far. I'm going to travel all through Brasil in January so i bought this to capture the moments, i've used it since i bought it and i have to say im happy for it and very excited for my trip with this baby. And when i say baby i mean it, its very small. Its perfect for me!January Update: Not so great I've finally used the camera and the zoom makes the pictures all blurry and at night you can FORGET ABOUT IT! It sucks! Want to take pictures at night? Buy another camera! Battery life is so so.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something small and compact-this camera is great!  No issues with and I would gladly buy another one!

Reviews.Title: Did not meet expectations.
Reviews.Author: Virginia A. Overman
Reviews.Content: I thought this camera would be easy to use according to Consumer Reports, but it wasn't.  We may have had operator problems, but it did not take the pictures as well as we were expecting.  It quit working about 2 weeks after the warranty ran out.  We were disappointed in the product.

Reviews.Title: It's ok but I wish I had purchased a different camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth V. Bostick
Reviews.Content: This camera was highly recommended to me by someone who already had one but I am not satisfied with the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Short life, only good for still shots
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: Camera died in 14 months. Indicated lens error. Picture quality was only good for still shots. Not good for taking pics of kids.

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim is just that...SLIM
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Judd "Art Quilter"
Reviews.Content: I have been getting adjusted to this very slim version of a camera. Holding it is a bit more of a challenge even with small hands and thin fingers. I just took it on a 5 day Boundary Waters trip in September and it took gorgeous photos as long as I didn't zoom in too closely. The high resolution of the camera even at just the 6mb size images makes it difficult to get clear photos without the tripod when zooming in. I didn't have that issue with my previous Casio, but it only took 10mb images at its max setting.I would have preferred the previous charger options where you could charge the battery outside the came instead of having to do it while in the camera as I always have a spare battery but can deal with that by just having 2 spare batteries.Downloading time to my computer is really quick which I like as well. I use the Adobe Bridge software so all of my images are custom named and my copyright is automatically imbedded in each image.I would highly recommend this camera as it is sleek, compact and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: CharlyO
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product to replace a lost one....but without the need to expend too much money; I was affraid that because it was a used one may be the quality and appreance not so good....but I was surprise to see a product like a new one and with the same functionality ...you never know when you are going to find a used product with such good quality and price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, weak Battery
Reviews.Author: Inspector John
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice, easy to hold and shoot.  It takes very crisp photographs.It fits in the palm of my hand.  However, the fully charged battery runs out before I can take 500 pictures.  It has gotten close to 500 a few times if all of the pictures are outside, but when using the flash, it rarely goes beyond 300.  So, if you need to take a lot of pictures, get a spare battery when you order the camera.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Santiagos Curse
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera.  It takes great pictures and videos.  I owned another one and lost it. :(  The only thing I don't like about this camera is that it does not have the option to take multiple shots with one click.  My other Exilim had this option and it made for great pictures especially with a 2 year old that moves a lot. I am also having problems connecting it to my computer.  This could be my computer's fault though.  Hahaha.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: pdm
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for an earlier Casio Exilim model (3 MP).  The previous model took great pictures and was incredibly reliable.  After 5+ years, the screen of the older model was damaged when I sat on it while it was in my back pocket...my fault.  The newer model couldn't have been more of a disappointment.  The shutter speed was slower and the lense mechanism has been rendered utterly useless after only 8 months of use.  This is a cheap piece of crap compared to the earlier model.  Regardless of your expectations, I recommend that you buy a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: LB
Reviews.Content: This camera is average.Best zoom O have ever seen in a camera in the category.Good pictures and reasonable sets of features.Poor in low light.Awful touch screen and navigation.

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1 Megapixels with 720p HD Video
5x Optical zoom with 26mm wide angle lens
2.7 inch 230K LCD monitor
Face detection
Easy mode with 23 Best Shot Modes
ProductInfo.Name: Casio Exilim EX-ZS10 Black 14 MP Stylish and Slim Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Zoom and 720p HD Video Capture
